Articles.Content:
I commentate as I take my Kerbalnots on a high flying adventure from the surface to rendezvous with a Kerbal station. Once I pick up a passenger from the station I will take the adventure to the moon (Mun). Where the adventure will come to an end.

KSP version 0.16

I used many of the Mod Parts found in these forums and had so much fun I decided to make a video:

I have finally figured out my Black bars\HD problem on youtube. So I will re upload this second video in the correct format. But it\'s gonna take a while because my files sizes got a bit bigger. Unfortunately I recorded the first video in SD and the original files have been deleted. But all future videos will in 16:9 HD

Continued...... =P 'I accidently keep calling Kerbin Minmus in this video' sorry for the confusion.

Just for fun I did a promo Video

Edited August 7, 2012 by OperationDx
Update Info
Sorry about the low res I\'ll do better next time. I just started trying to do game videos and I\'m still working out all the details. Did anyone like this video?

Very, very good video, so much on display! I saw the length and thought I\'d skip around, but I ended up watching the whole thing, there was never a dull moment. The address to the kerbonauts at the beginning was hilarious ;D

And yeah, the resolution could have been better, but it\'s a small problem.

Very, very good video, so much on display! I saw the length and thought I\'d skip around, but I ended up watching the whole thing, there was never a dull moment. The address to the kerbonauts at the beginning was hilarious ;D

And yeah, the resolution could have been better, but it\'s a small problem.

Thanks a ton Dizzle. I was getting worried because no one was saying anything.

Wow! Amazing! Even if the fuel was modified that was still extremely impressive! I can\'t even get orbits on the same plane, and you can do all that? Congrats on the video, I will subscribe and I hope to see more!

I think the commentary is really great, and the video is interesting. ;D

Keep up the great work.

Absolutely fantastic! Your commentary was great and the content was spectacular!

One of the best KSP videos I have seen thus far.

KEEP MAKING MORE!

Sooooooo COOOOL!!!!!!! 8)

Did my first orbital transfer last night. Forgot to add RCS but was successful anyway (even though Jeb had to space-walk for about 8km :-[) . But they all survived and that\'s the main thing!

Vid was great mate, watched the whole thing.

Congrats!!!

I enjoyed the video a lot. You perfectly captured the challenge and satisfaction of flying realistic space missions while demonstrating how remarkable KSP is.

Also, you have mad skillz ( ) Nice to see another Orbiter veteran.

Wow! Amazing! Even if the fuel was modified that was still extremely impressive! I can\'t even get orbits on the same plane, and you can do all that? Congrats on the video, I will subscribe and I hope to see more!

It\'s because I used to play Orbiter. It\'s a bit more challenging then KSP. But when you do plane changes you want to burn when the 2 orbits intersect. That\'s when you burn normal and anti normal. But thanks I\'m glad you enjoyed the video.
Thanks guys. I didn\'t think I would get this good of a response. WOW!

The take-away here is:

Make. More. Videos.

Indeed. Already planing my next few and making sure I have the correct video settings this time around.

I made a second part to my video....

A Kerbal Space Program Disaster

Wow! More please!

Just a little thing: Minmus is the second moon of Kerbin:) Other than that, awesome video. I\'m subscribing to you channel.

Wow! More please!

Just a little thing: Minmus is the second moon of Kerbin:) Other than that, awesome video. I\'m subscribing to you channel.

Yep! I completely spaced on that one. I\'ve been wanting to do a mission to minmus. Maybe that why I kept calling Kerbin Minmus.
Great videos but I couldn\'t help but notice you went into retrograde orbit. Tilt the other way, it saves fuel.

Great videos but I couldn\'t help but notice you went into retrograde orbit. Tilt the other way, it saves fuel.

Indeed. My next setup in the future will be in a prograde orbit.
